comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Susan Walker Fitzgerald (1871-1943)--see [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2850362011/] Emma Bugbee (1888-1981): www.goddesscafe.com/FEMJOUR/bugbee.html Harriot Stanton Blatch (1856-1940): www25.uua.org/uuhs/duub/articles/harriotstantonblatch.html [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163814210/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
During the Woman Suffrage Parade in New York City, July 30, 1913. Harriot Stanton Blatch organized that parade and others in 1908, 1910 and 1912.

Waiting for the driver? Or has he/she stepped out of the seat to allow the picture to be taken?

comment.author: 99217767@N00

Neat photo!

comment.author: 27869749@N06
comment._content: Susan Walker Fitzgerald was an ardent suffragist and served as first female Representative in the Great and General Court of Massachusetts (legislature). She lived at 7 Greenough Avenue in Jamaica Plain. More info at www.jphs.org

comment._content: Thanks for all the information you've gathered.  We'll update the record.
